pullRequest.body:
prove multiplication of surreal numbers is well-defined, thus they form an ordered commutative ring


This is a port of a Lean 3 proof from [this mathlib branch](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib/blob/surreal_mul_symm'/src/set_theory/surreal/basic.lean). It shows that multiplication of surreal numbers is well-defined, and therefore the surreal numbers form an ordered commutative ring.

Because `Surreal` is now a ring, the simp normal-form for scalar multiplication (by integers) is now `*`. This required changes throughout `SetTheory/Surreal/Dyadic`.

For the most part, I translated the Lean 3 code directly to Lean 4, although in a few cases, I couldn't get that to work and wrote a new proof instead.

There were some lemmas used that were in the mathlib branch that were not ported to mathlib4. I have ported those lemmas and put them in an appropriate place in mathlib4.

I copied over the author names from the Lean 3 code and added myself.

---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

Also, I haven't seen @vihdzp around for a while but I think this is worth a notification. also cc @apurvanakade
I'll try to have a look soon-ish, but won't have a lot of time this week because of the AIM workshop (plus teaching etc. as usual).

Two minor comments, but otherwise I'm happy.

Okay I think I've done cleaning up the PR. Maybe @MichaelStollBayreuth (coauthor of the original proof) would be interested in taking a look, and then I think we can merge this!

Thanks for porting and opening the PR! Here are some initial comments, and I'll probably do some cleanups myself later. (There's a algebraic geometry formalization workshop this week, so my time will be limited ...)
Thanks for your work! I've pushed some more cleanups. I think the only thing remaining is to clean up the draft docs, which I should be able to do by the end of tomorrow.
Okay I think I've done cleaning up the PR. Maybe @MichaelStollBayreuth (coauthor of the original proof) would be interested in taking a look, and then I think we can merge this!

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion | (Args.P1 x y) => {x, y} ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion | (Args.P1 x y) => Numeric (x * y) ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion (hl : x₁ ≤ x₂.moveLeft i) : P3 x₁ x₂ y₁ y₂ := by ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion simp? ```
I'd suggest deferring any material that needs this import to a separate file.
e.g. `Surreal.Multiplication`.

The `Hydra` material is needed at the early parts of the multiplication proof so I don't see a way to do that without moving the whole multiplication proof to a separate file. Maybe that is a good idea anyway since the multiplication proof is quite complicated on its own. I will do that.

```suggestion
lemma ArgsRel.numeric_closed {a' a} : ArgsRel a' a → a.Numeric → a'.Numeric :=
  TransGen.closed2 $ @cutExpand_closed _ IsOption ⟨wf_isOption.isIrrefl.1⟩ _ Numeric.isOption
```
(untested. probably didn't work in Lean 3 but worth giving a try in Lean 4)

```suggestion
/-- The nontrivial part of P1 in [SchleicherStoll] says that the left options of `x * y`
  are less than the right options, and this is the general form of these statements. -/
```
to make it clear that our P₁ is an adapted version of P₁ in the original reference.

Also, maybe we should change all P1 to P₁, etc. because subscripts are used in the original reference.

```suggestion
  ⟦x₁ * y₁⟧ + ⟦x₂ * y₂⟧ - ⟦x₁ * y₂⟧ < ⟦x₃ * y₁⟧ + ⟦x₂ * y₃⟧ - (⟦x₃ * y₃⟧ : Game)
```
and elsewhere
I think we prefer not using variable names in declaration names. So `P2_neg_left/right` would be better. Even if we keep the `x`, there should be an extra underscore (`P2_neg_x`).

```suggestion

/-- The multiset associated to a list of arguments. -/
def Args.toMultiset : Args → Multiset PGame
  | (Args.P1 x y) => {x, y}
  | (Args.P24 x₁ x₂ y) => {x₁, x₂, y}

/-- A list of arguments is numeric if all the arguments are. -/
def Args.Numeric (a : Args) := ∀ x ∈ a.toMultiset, SetTheory.PGame.Numeric x

```

```suggestion

/-- The statement that we will be shown by induction using the well-founded relation `ArgsRel`. -/
def P124 : Args → Prop
  | (Args.P1 x y) => Numeric (x * y)
  | (Args.P24 x₁ x₂ y) => P24 x₁ x₂ y

```

```suggestion
  ∀ ⦃x₁ x₂ y'⦄, IsOption x₁ x → IsOption x₂ x → (y' = y ∨ IsOption y' y) → P24 x₁ x₂ y'
```

I think removing the braces should work but I'm not sure about removing the parentheses
```suggestion
  all_goals
    apply Numeric.sub
    apply Numeric.add
    apply ihnx ih
    pick_goal 2
    apply ihny ih
    pick_goal 3
    apply ihnxy ih
  all_goals solve_by_elim [IsOption.mk_left, IsOption.mk_right]
```
Removing the parentheses works.

```suggestion
```
it seems the `omit` `include` become blank lines through porting ... (or did you say you ported manually?)
I ported manually.  I might have removed the `omit` and `include` statements without deleting the line.  Anyway I went through and removed all the extraneous blank lines.

```suggestion
  refine fun z => ⟨?_, ?_, ?_⟩ <;>
    refine fun h => ih' (Args.P24 _ _ _) (TransGen.single ?_)
```

```suggestion
lemma ih₂₁ : ih24 x₂ x₁ y := ih₁₂ <| by
  simp_rw [ArgsRel, InvImage, Args.toMultiset, Multiset.pair_comm] at ih' ⊢
  suffices {x₁, y, x₂} = {x₂, y, x₁} by rwa [← this]
  dsimp [← Multiset.singleton_add] at ih' ⊢
  abel
```
TODO: clean up the next few lemmas myself
I cleaned up some things in the next few lemmas following your other suggestions, but leaving this open in case you think there is more cleanup needed.
This part is in draft form and that was the main reason why I didn't open a PR. Not sure how much I could recall about what I intended to say ...

I see that the `2` is to distinguish with [Relation.TransGen.closed](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Logic/Relation.html#Relation.TransGen.closed), but I think `closed'` is better for this purpose. It doesn't appear that this one is more "2" than the other one.

I renamed `ih1` to `IH1` according to naming convention, and then I can rename `ih1xy` to `ih1`, and `ih1yx` to `ih1_swap`. (I think `swap` is more common than `rev`, which is applied to lists/strings where there may be more than one element.)
I renamed these to `numeric_(option_)mul(_option)`.

```suggestion
In `Mathlib.SetTheory.Surreal.Multiplication`, we define multiplication and show that the
```
This should be Theodore Hwa, now?

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(SetTheory/Surreal/Basic): surreal number multiplication
